definition[0]: the time it takes to receive something, deal with it and send it back, especially on a plane, ship etc
example[0]: The average turnaround for a passport application is six working days.
example[1]: We must reduce costs and shorten turnaround times.
definition[1]: a complete change from a bad situation to a good one
example[2]: the remarkable turnaround in our economy
definition[3]: the time between receiving an order for goods, dealing with it, and sending the goods to the customer
example[3]: Some drivers are on a bonus for fast turnaround and deliveries.
example[4]: The large increase in sales indicates a turnaround for the company, which ran into tough times during the early 1990s.
example[5]: Managers don’t expect a turnaround in profits yet.
definition[4]: a complete change in someone’s opinion or ideas
